subject: Photography
title: Color Harmony in Nature
description: Learn Color Harmony in Nature in one minute.

hook.text: Nature doesn't study color theory. Yet every sunset, forest, and coral reef is a masterclass in color harmony.

buildup.text: Natural palettes evolved over millions of years. They look right because our eyes evolved alongside them.

discovery.text: Flowers use contrasting colors to attract pollinators. Autumn leaves shift from green to warm analogous palettes.

twist.text: Photographing nature's color is easy. The hard part is learning why those palettes work â€” then applying them elsewhere.

climax.text: Nature is the best color teacher. Study a garden and you'll learn more than any textbook can teach.

punchline.text: Nature invented color theory. We just wrote it down.

quiz.question: Why do natural color palettes look harmonious to humans?
options: Human vision evolved alongside natural color patterns over millions of years
All colors in nature are the same
